azurerm_route.description: Manages a Route within a Route Table.

name.description: The name of the route. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

resource_group_name.description: The name of the resource group in which to create the route. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

route_table_name.description: The name of the route table within which create the route. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

address_prefix.description: The destination CIDR to which the route applies, such as `10.1.0.0/16`

next_hop_type.description: The type of Azure hop the packet should be sent to. Possible values are `VirtualNetworkGateway`, `VnetLocal`, `Internet`, `VirtualAppliance` and `None`

next_hop_in_ip_address.description: Contains the IP address packets should be forwarded to. Next hop values are only allowed in routes where the next hop type is `VirtualAppliance`.
